3667040;R - for absolute beginners;FALSE;2021-01-26T11:30:00Z;2021-01-26T13:30:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical data analysis. We begin with the very basics - no prior knowledge required!
Please note: The course will be held online due to COVID-19 restrictions. A Zoom-link will be mailed to participants two days ahead of the course.
Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

Registration is open to students, staff and faculty from the University of Copenhagen. If you do not come from UCPH - send us an email (kubdatalab@kb.dk) and we'll figure it out.

3661506;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-02-09T09:30:00Z;2021-02-09T12:30:00Z;"

Bemærk: Dette kursus forventes at blive afholdt online via Zoom. Link vil blive tilsendt til deltagere.
Skulle situationen ændre sig, så vi kan afholde det som tilstedeværelsesundervisning, vil deltagerne blive informeret.

Introduktion til programmet NVivo 12, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3676276;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-02-17T10:00:00Z;2021-02-17T11:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: In addition to these hands-on exercises, you will see examples of how OpenRefine can be used to enrich your data with data from online sources.

You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • Excel user (familiar with basic use of excel)

• If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)
• Got a brief introduction to how OpenRefine can help you enrich your data with data from online sources

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see attachment in date, time, etc. box below)
• Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3676276;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-02-17T10:00:00Z;2021-02-17T11:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: In addition to these hands-on exercises, you will see examples of how OpenRefine can be used to enrich your data with data from online sources.

You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • Excel user (familiar with basic use of excel)

• If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)
• Got a brief introduction to how OpenRefine can help you enrich your data with data from online sources

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see attachment in date, time, etc. box below)
• Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3665780;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2021-02-22T12:00:00Z;2021-02-22T15:00:00Z;"

Please note: We are currently expecting to hold this course online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Should the situation change and make classroom teaching possible, attendees will be informed via mail.
Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)
Introduction to NVivo 12. A programme, which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo 12 can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3661348;Excel for samfundsvidenskab - online;FALSE;2021-02-24T09:00:00Z;2021-02-24T11:30:00Z;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores online workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Workshoppen er live, og vi bruger Zoom. Skiftet til online undervisning i et avanceret program er nyt, men vi prøver at holde den uformelle workshopstil, så godt vi kan. Derfor beder vi alle deltagerne tænde deres webcam.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019). (2) Installér Zoom Client for Meetings inden (vi skal bruge nogle funktioner, som Zoom i din browser ikke har). (3) Test, webcam og mikrofon virker med Zoom.

Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

3683393;R - for absolute beginners;FALSE;2021-02-25T11:30:00Z;2021-02-25T13:30:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical data analysis. We begin with the very basics - no prior knowledge required!
Please note: The course will be held online. A Zoom-link will be mailed to participants two days before the course.
Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

Registration is open to students, staff and faculty from the University of Copenhagen. If you do not come from UCPH - send us an email (kubdatalab@kb.dk) and we'll figure it out.

3671043;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-03-09T09:00:00Z;2021-03-09T11:00:00Z;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course aimed at Windows-users. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo, offered in Danish and English, are also available, read more in the course calendar.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo12 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in  organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus on Nvivo in literature reviews.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul role=""list"">

column2: <li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""1"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications, formatting documents for auto coding, and working with code books and other reports.
<li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""2"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memo-ing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Due to Corona, the course will until further notice only be offered online Hopefully, later in the year, we can hold physical workshops again at the library.
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)
Related website with more workshops and tutorials

Related courses in Nvivo (danish & English)

<li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""2"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memo-ing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Due to Corona, the course will until further notice only be offered online Hopefully, later in the year, we can hold physical workshops again at the library.
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)

Related courses in Nvivo (danish & English)

3661349;Excel for samfundsvidenskab - online;FALSE;2021-03-09T11:30:00Z;2021-03-09T14:00:00Z;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores online workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Workshoppen er live, og vi bruger Zoom. Skiftet til online undervisning i et avanceret program er nyt, men vi prøver at holde den uformelle workshopstil, så godt vi kan. Derfor beder vi alle deltagerne tænde deres webcam.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019). (2) Installér Zoom Client for Meetings inden (vi skal bruge nogle funktioner, som Zoom i din browser ikke har). (3) Test, webcam og mikrofon virker med Zoom.

3668847;Online -- Tekstanalyse med fokus på Voyant Tools, og hvordan digital metoder kan anvendes på en meningsfyldt måde;FALSE;2021-03-16T11:30:00Z;2021-03-16T13:30:00Z;"

Det overordnede formål er at få en god oplevelse og bidrage til en nysgerrighed for digital humaniora.
Formålet er også gennem praktiske øvelser at skabe læring om applicering af digital tekstanalyse i litteraturstudier og de begreber og metoder, der knytter sig dertil.
Efter kurset har deltagerne opnået et kendskab til:
-    Softwaren Voyant Tools
-    Begreberne korrelation, kollokation, relativ frekvens, key-word-in-context, n-grams, stopwords

Kurset er online. Tilmelding lukker en dag før kursusstart. Kontakt venligst Lars Kjær, lakj@kb.dk, for mere information.

3676398;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-03-22T13:00:00Z;2021-03-22T14:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation before the course:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding option (GREL)

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see attachment in date, time, etc. box below)
• Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) (https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has a electronic copy)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.

3665778;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-03-24T12:00:00Z;2021-03-24T15:00:00Z;"

Bemærk: Dette kursus forventes at blive afholdt online via Zoom. Link vil blive tilsendt til deltagere.
Skulle situationen ændre sig, så vi kan afholde det som tilstedeværelsesundervisning, vil deltagerne blive informeret.

Introduktion til programmet NVivo 12, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3671044;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-04-09T08:00:00Z;2021-04-09T10:00:00Z;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course aimed at Windows-users. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo, offered in Danish and English, are also available, read more in the course calendar.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo12 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in  organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus on Nvivo in literature reviews using articles in PDF form.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul role=""list"">

column2: <li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""1"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">
Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications and working with code books and other reports.
<li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""2"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memo-ing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Due to Corona, the course will until further notice only be offered online Hopefully, later in the year, we can hold physical workshops again at the library.
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)
Related website with more workshops and tutorials

Related courses in Nvivo (danish & English)

3661350;Excel for samfundsvidenskab - online;FALSE;2021-04-14T08:00:00Z;2021-04-14T10:30:00Z;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores online workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Workshoppen er live, og vi bruger Zoom. Skiftet til online undervisning i et avanceret program er nyt, men vi prøver at holde den uformelle workshopstil, så godt vi kan. Derfor beder vi alle deltagerne tænde deres webcam.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019). (2) Installér Zoom Client for Meetings inden (vi skal bruge nogle funktioner, som Zoom i din browser ikke har). (3) Test, webcam og mikrofon virker med Zoom.

3661350;Excel for samfundsvidenskab - online;FALSE;2021-04-14T08:00:00Z;2021-04-14T10:30:00Z;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores online workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

3668848;Online -- Tekstanalyse med fokus på Voyant Tools, og hvordan digital metoder kan anvendes på en meningsfyldt måde;FALSE;2021-04-15T10:30:00Z;2021-04-15T12:30:00Z;"

Det overordnede formål er at få en god oplevelse og bidrage til en nysgerrighed for digital humaniora.
Formålet er også gennem praktiske øvelser at skabe læring om applicering af digital tekstanalyse i litteraturstudier og de begreber og metoder, der knytter sig dertil.
Efter kurset har deltagerne opnået et kendskab til:
-    Softwaren Voyant Tools
-    Begreberne korrelation, kollokation, relativ frekvens, key-word-in-context, n-grams, stopwords

Kurset er online. Tilmelding lukker en dag før kursusstart. Kontakt venligst Lars Kjær, lakj@kb.dk, for mere information.

3665782;NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2021-04-20T08:30:00Z;2021-04-20T11:30:00Z;"

Please note: We are currently expecting to hold this course online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Should the situation change and make classroom teaching possible, attendees will be informed via mail.
Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)
Introduction to NVivo 12. A programme, which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo 12 can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3676400;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-04-27T10:00:00Z;2021-04-27T11:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see attached file in box with date and time information)
• Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) (https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has a electronic copy)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

";https://kubkalender.kb.dk/event/3676400;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/aevent.php?c=6416&m=edit&event_id=3676400;14440;0;Online på Zoom;NA;NA;NA;33561;Cleaning;9829;Michael Svendsen;Marianne Gauffriau & Erik Schwägermann;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;TRUE;TRUE;TRUE;25;2;0;0;2;TRUE;#18E0F2;https://lcimages-eu.s3.amazonaws.com/data/feat_img/1069/6416/1611067913.png;NA;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see attached file in box with date and time information)
• Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) (https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has a electronic copy)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

3676400;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-04-27T10:00:00Z;2021-04-27T11:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

3665779;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-05-10T11:00:00Z;2021-05-10T14:00:00Z;"

Bemærk: Dette kursus forventes at blive afholdt online via Zoom. Link vil blive tilsendt til deltagere.
Skulle situationen ændre sig, så vi kan afholde det som tilstedeværelsesundervisning, vil deltagerne blive informeret.

Introduktion til programmet NVivo 12, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3676399;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-05-11T09:00:00Z;2021-05-11T10:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: In addition to these hands-on exercises, you will see examples of how OpenRefine can be used to enrich your data with data from online sources.

You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • Excel user (familiar with basic use of excel)

• If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)
• Got a brief introduction to how OpenRefine can help you enrich your data with data from online sources

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) (https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has a electronic copy)

column1: Where
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3676399;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-05-11T09:00:00Z;2021-05-11T10:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
At the course you will:
<ul>

column2: • Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: In addition to these hands-on exercises, you will see examples of how OpenRefine can be used to enrich your data with data from online sources.

You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
The course is a basic introduction. You are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Requirements and preparation:
<ul>

column2: • Excel user (familiar with basic use of excel)

• If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you will have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which tasks you can use the tool and for which tasks are other tools more appropriate
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions)
• Got a brief introduction to how OpenRefine can help you enrich your data with data from online sources

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises for the course (we will work with these exercises during the course) (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel-file you can use if you don’t bring your own data (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) (https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has a electronic copy)

3661351;Excel for samfundsvidenskab - online;FALSE;2021-05-17T10:00:00Z;2021-05-17T12:30:00Z;"

Vil du gerne have styr på Microsoft Excel, så kig forbi til vores online workshop. Fokus er på brug af Excel til opgaver og studiet - er du i forvejen avanceret bruger af Excel, er dette muligvis ikke en workshop for dig.
Excel er et stærkt tal- og databehandlingsværktøj, der kan analysere og skabe overblik over store mængder data og vise dét, du vil fremhæve, i dine opgaver i form af tabeller og diagrammer.

Vi introducerer Excels terminologi og gennemgår basisfunktioner, betinget formatering, sortering, tabeller og diagrammer. Vi arbejder med rensning og klargøring af data, og vi arbejder med større datasæt og avancerede værktøjer i form af pivottabeller og visualisering af data i grafer og figurer, samt eksempler på avancerede Excel-funktioner.
Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af Excel, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

Workshoppen er live, og vi bruger Zoom. Skiftet til online undervisning i et avanceret program er nyt, men vi prøver at holde den uformelle workshopstil, så godt vi kan. Derfor beder vi alle deltagerne tænde deres webcam.

Vigtigt og praktisk inden kurset: (1) Hav Excel installeret på din laptop (helst Excel 2013/2016/2019). (2) Installér Zoom Client for Meetings inden (vi skal bruge nogle funktioner, som Zoom i din browser ikke har). (3) Test, webcam og mikrofon virker med Zoom.

3671045;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-05-19T08:00:00Z;2021-05-19T10:00:00Z;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course aimed at Windows-users. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo, offered in Danish and English, are also available, read more in the course calendar.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo12 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in  organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus on Nvivo in literature reviews.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul role=""list"">

column2: <li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""1"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications, formatting documents for auto coding, and working with code books and other reports.
<li aria-setsize=""-1"" data-aria-level=""1"" data-aria-posinset=""2"" data-font=""Symbol"" data-leveltext=""<U+F0B7>"" data-listid=""1"" role=""listitem"">

Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memo-ing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop
The course requires a minimum of six participants.
Due to Corona, the course will until further notice only be offered online Hopefully, later in the year, we can hold physical workshops again at the library.
You will receive a Zoom link two days before the course.
/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)
Related website with more workshops and tutorials

Related courses in Nvivo (danish & English)

3668392;Visualisering af forskning: Workshop i VOSviewer - online;FALSE;2021-05-19T08:00:00Z;2021-05-19T10:30:00Z;"

Programmet VOSviewer giver mulighed for fortolkning af forskningsfelter gennem visualisering. Ved hjælp af publikationsdata indhentet fra f.eks. Web of Science eller Scopus, kan der dannes billeder af emneords-, forfatter- og citationsnetværker. Hvordan udvikler et forskningsområde sig over tid? Hvilke forskningsområder vinder udbredelse og hvilken impact har de? Hvordan er forskningen bundet sammen? Dette er nogle af de mulige fortolkninger, der kan synliggøres ved billeddannelserne.
Der er tale om en workshop, hvor vi sammen udvikler visualiseringer. Underviseren demonstrerer programmet og de tekniske muligheder. Du kommer med spørgsmålene til og viden om et forskningsfelt.
Workshoppen afholdes online via Zoom. Link udsendes kort ført kursusstart.
Målgruppe: alle studerende og forskere ved KU
Inden kurset bedes du downloade programmet og sikrer dig at det fungerer på din maskine: https://www.vosviewer.com/

Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

3668392;Visualisering af forskning: Workshop i VOSviewer - online;FALSE;2021-05-19T08:00:00Z;2021-05-19T10:30:00Z;"

Programmet VOSviewer giver mulighed for fortolkning af forskningsfelter gennem visualisering. Ved hjælp af publikationsdata indhentet fra f.eks. Web of Science eller Scopus, kan der dannes billeder af emneords-, forfatter- og citationsnetværker. Hvordan udvikler et forskningsområde sig over tid? Hvilke forskningsområder vinder udbredelse og hvilken impact har de? Hvordan er forskningen bundet sammen? Dette er nogle af de mulige fortolkninger, der kan synliggøres ved billeddannelserne.
Der er tale om en workshop, hvor vi sammen udvikler visualiseringer. Underviseren demonstrerer programmet og de tekniske muligheder. Du kommer med spørgsmålene til og viden om et forskningsfelt.
Workshoppen afholdes online via Zoom. Link udsendes kort ført kursusstart.
Målgruppe: alle studerende og forskere ved KU
Inden kurset bedes du downloade programmet og sikrer dig at det fungerer på din maskine: https://www.vosviewer.com/

Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

It will deal with issues like:
<ul>

column2: • how to get the data into R

column1: Hopefully this would be an onsite workshop, that will be held at KUB Datalab South Campus, Karen Blixens Plads 7, 2300 Copenhagen S.

3760523;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-08-25T10:30:00Z;2021-08-25T12:30:00Z;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3769230;R for Absolute Beginners;FALSE;2021-08-31T11:00:00Z;2021-08-31T13:00:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3749467;Python og Digital Humaniora - Online grundkursus;FALSE;2021-09-07T10:30:00Z;2021-09-07T12:30:00Z;"

Kurset hedder 'Python og Digital Humaniora', men studerende fra alle fag er meget velkommen til at tilmelde sig.

Formålet er primært at få en god oplevelse og sekundært at lære lidt om, hvordan man kan benytte programmeringssproget Python inden for fag, hvor man arbejder typisk arbejder med tekster som datagrundlag, f.eks. humaniora, teologi, jura, samfunds- og sundsfag.
Vi bruger Jupyter notebook, der er en del af en pakke, der hedder Anaconda, som man inden kurset skal have downloadet og installeret herfra:
https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
Cirka 24 timer inden kursusstart vil tilmeldte deltagere via mail modtage mødelink og materiale i en zipfil til brug på workshoppen.

NB:. Kurset starter på det angivende klokkeslet og ikke efter et akademisk kvarter.

3778035;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-09-10T08:30:00Z;2021-09-10T10:30:00Z;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3749472;Python og Digital Humaniora - Videregående online kursus med fokus på Regex;FALSE;2021-09-14T10:30:00Z;2021-09-14T12:30:00Z;"

Kurset hedder 'Python og Digital Humaniora', men studerende fra alle fag er meget velkommen til at tilmelde sig.
På de videregående kurser handler det om Python-biblioteker som BeautifulSoup, Pandas, sklearn, Seaborn og Regex, og det kan hurtigt virke lidt kompliceret.

Men ligesom på de grundlæggende kurser er formålet er primært at få en god oplevelse og sekundært at lære lidt om, hvordan man kan benytte programmeringssproget Python inden for fag, hvor man arbejder typisk arbejder med tekster som datagrundlag, f.eks. humaniora, teologi, jura, samfunds- og sundsfag.
Vi bruger Jupyter notebook, der er en del af en pakke, der hedder Anaconda, som man inden kurset skal have downloadet og installeret herfra: https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
Cirka 24 timer inden kursusstart vil tilmeldte deltagere via mail modtage mødelink og materiale i en zipfil til brug på workshoppen.

NB:. Kurset starter på det angivende klokkeslet og ikke efter et akademisk kvarter.

3768374;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-09-15T11:00:00Z;2021-09-15T12:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see the time and date box below)
• Exercises that we will use at the course (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3768374;Online introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-09-15T11:00:00Z;2021-09-15T12:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Instructor’s presentation (see the time and date box below)
• Exercises that we will use at the course (https://datacarpentry.org/openrefine-socialsci/)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (https://ndownloader.figshare.com/files/11502815)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information
A zoom-link will be sent to attendees the day before the course.

Please also note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3761073;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2021-09-20T10:30:00Z;2021-09-20T13:00:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3760527;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-09-22T10:30:00Z;2021-09-22T12:30:00Z;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3759621;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-09-23T08:30:00Z;2021-09-23T10:30:00Z;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek.
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3750606;Forskerstudiegruppe: Python og digital humaniora - Fokus på XML-filer;FALSE;2021-09-24T07:00:00Z;2021-09-24T09:00:00Z;"

Denne workshop foregår i regi af en studiegruppe for forskere med interesse i digital humaniora og hovedsageligt litteraturstudier. Studiegruppen mødes cirka fire gange hvert semester med det formål at udforske digitale metoder. Udforskningen foregår dels gennem kodning og konkret anvendelse, dels gennem samtaler om metodernes udfordringer og potentialer.
En typisk workshop tager to timer, foregår online, og der er ikke forberedelse forbundet dermed.

For mere information om studiegruppen kontakt venligst Lars Kjær, lakj@kb.dk, der er gruppens tovholder.

S;NA;32027;Datalab;9876;Lars Kjær;Lars Kjær;6416;KUB Datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/calendar/datalab;https://kubkalender.kb.dk/admin/calendar/6416;FALSE;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;#18E0F2;NA;NA;0;0;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA;NA

3749478;Introduktion til ArcGIS Online;FALSE;2021-09-24T10:30:00Z;2021-09-24T12:30:00Z;"

Dette kursus er en kort og praktisk introduktion til at bruge ArcGIS Online. ArcGIS Online kan benyttes til at bygge og udgive online kort og apps, hvis du har dine data velstrukturet og organiseret i et regneark.
Kurset handler om følgende emner:
<ul>

column2: • Hvordan man strukturer data for at kunne blive anvendet til visualiseringer i ArcGIS Online
• Hvordan man producerer en ArcGIS Online web app

column1: Kurset tager udgangspunkt i data, der stammer fra en folketælling, og på den måde er kurset oplagt for studerende fra historie og etnologi, men alle er selvfølgelig velkommen og der vil også være tid til at snakke om, hvordan du skal struktuere dine data, hvis du vil lave kort og apps ud fra dine kilder.

Inden kurset begynder modtager tilmeldte deltagere et link til ArcGIS Online, en zipfil med data og et mødelink.

3773049;Data Carpentry Workshop 27th & 28th September;FALSE;2021-09-27T07:00:00Z;2021-09-27T15:00:00Z;"

Join our Data Carpentry workshop the 27th & 28th of September! Data Carpentry is a hands-on, two-day training on the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. We’ll get to grips with tidy data in spread sheets and fundamental descriptive analysis in R and much more to get you started working responsibly and methodologically with data. The target audience is students and researchers who have little to no prior computational experience. Read more on the event webpage, where you'll find information about the lessons, software and installation.
General Information

Data Carpentry develops and teaches workshops on the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. Its target audience is students and researchers who have little to no prior computational experience, and its lessons are domain specific, building on learners' existing knowledge to enable them to quickly apply skills learned to their own research. Participants will be encouraged to help one another and to apply what they have learned to their own research problems.
Who: The course is aimed at bachelor, master, PhD. students and other researchers. You don't need to have any previous knowledge of the tools that will be presented at the workshop.
Where: Room U14 – 10.4.469 Universitetsparken 2, 2100 Copenhagen.
When: Sept 27-28, 2021.
Time: 9am to 5pm both days

Requirements: Participants must bring a laptop with a Mac, Linux, or Windows operating system (not a tablet, Chromebook, etc.) that they have administrative privileges on. They should have a few specific software packages installed. Please check the workshop website.
Accessibility: We are committed to making this workshop accessible to everybody. The workshop organizers have checked that:
<ul>

Materials will be provided in advance of the workshop and large-print handouts are available if needed by notifying the organizers in advance. If we can help making learning easier for you (e.g. sign-language interpreters, lactation facilities) please get in touch (using contact details below) and we will attempt to provide them.

Contact: Please email lowi@kb.dk for more information

3773049;Data Carpentry Workshop 27th & 28th September;FALSE;2021-09-27T07:00:00Z;2021-09-27T15:00:00Z;"

Join our Data Carpentry workshop the 27th & 28th of September! Data Carpentry is a hands-on, two-day training on the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. We’ll get to grips with tidy data in spread sheets and fundamental descriptive analysis in R and much more to get you started working responsibly and methodologically with data. The target audience is students and researchers who have little to no prior computational experience. Read more on the event webpage, where you'll find information about the lessons, software and installation.
General Information

Data Carpentry develops and teaches workshops on the fundamental data skills needed to conduct research. Its target audience is students and researchers who have little to no prior computational experience, and its lessons are domain specific, building on learners' existing knowledge to enable them to quickly apply skills learned to their own research. Participants will be encouraged to help one another and to apply what they have learned to their own research problems.
Who: The course is aimed at bachelor, master, PhD. students and other researchers. You don't need to have any previous knowledge of the tools that will be presented at the workshop.
Where: Room U14 – 10.4.469 Universitetsparken 2, 2100 Copenhagen.
When: Sept 27-28, 2021.
Time: 9am to 5pm both days

Requirements: Participants must bring a laptop with a Mac, Linux, or Windows operating system (not a tablet, Chromebook, etc.) that they have administrative privileges on. They should have a few specific software packages installed. Please check the workshop website.
Accessibility: We are committed to making this workshop accessible to everybody. The workshop organizers have checked that:
<ul>

Materials will be provided in advance of the workshop and large-print handouts are available if needed by notifying the organizers in advance. If we can help making learning easier for you (e.g. sign-language interpreters, lactation facilities) please get in touch (using contact details below) and we will attempt to provide them.

Contact: Please email lowi@kb.dk for more information

3760528;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-09-29T10:30:00Z;2021-09-29T12:30:00Z;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3759623;NVivo - Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS);FALSE;2021-09-29T10:30:00Z;2021-09-29T12:30:00Z;"

Introduktion til programmet NVivo, som er en stor hjælp til kvalitativ dataanalyse. NVivo kan bl.a. hjælpe dig med at organisere og kode din empiri og litteratur, generere hypoteser, transskribere din lyd/video og meget andet.

Undervisningen tager udgangspunkt i PC-versionen af NVivo, hvor programmet fungerer bedst. Mac-versionen er stadig ikke helt på niveau med PC-versionen, men det er dog stadig muligt at deltage med Mac.
Du bedes forud for kurset have installeret NVivo. Registreringsnøgle fås i KU’s software bibliotek. Vi benytter den nyeste version af NVivo i kurset. I software biblioteket benævnes den "NVivo 13".
Du bedes ligeledes forud for kurset gennemgå et par introducerende øvelser, som du kan læse om HER.
Gennemføres ved min. seks tilmeldte.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) og Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3759829;Nvivo for your literature reviews;FALSE;2021-09-30T08:00:00Z;2021-09-30T10:00:00Z;"

Please note: This is a beginners training course in Nvivo for your literature reviews. The sample dataset and discussions are drawn from the health sciences, but researchers and students from all faculties are of course welcome. Generic courses in Nvivo that introduce basic functions are also available, such as NVivo - NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) / Introduktion til kvalitativ dataanalyse-software (QDAS). There will be some overlap between the courses.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your computer. Download and registration keys are available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.

In this short course, you will be introduced to the NVivo 1.0 software. NVivo is a programme that can be used in analysis of qualitative survey data, interviews, focus group discussions as well as content analysis of text from many other different resources. Nvivo aids you in organising and/or “coding” (categorize) your empirical material or literature and visualizing relationships in your data. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses and generally getting an overview of your project.
In this workshop, we focus only on Nvivo in literature reviews using articles in PDF form.
At the end of the course participants will have learned and practised:
<ul>

column2: • Setting-up an NVivo project: importing data from reference managers, creating folders, using case nodes and classifications and working with code books.

• Using basic analysis features of NVivo: creating parent and child nodes, coding to nodes, reviewing and changing coding, annotations, applying ‘see also links’, memoing, performing queries, using coding visualizations to inform your search strategies, matrices and using project maps.

column1: NVivo does not analyze qualitative data for the researcher but rather can enhance the researcher’s analytical capacity by providing the means to efficiently store, sort and look for patterns in diverse forms of data. Training in NVivo is not a substitute for qualitative research training.

The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac. Likewise, there can even be small differences in the PC versions of NVivo as NVivo is frequently updated. We’ll take all this in our stride during the workshop.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Lorna Wildgaard (lowi@kb.dk) and Halle Rashdan (Hara@kb.dk)

3769228;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2021-09-30T08:00:00Z;2021-09-30T10:30:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

column1: In preparation for the course, we recommend that you either download and install R and RStudio, or register for an account at rstudio.cloud. Instructions on this can be found here, where you will also find the course notes, additional material and exercises.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3769228;R for Absolute Beginners - The Social Science Version;FALSE;2021-09-30T08:00:00Z;2021-09-30T10:30:00Z;"

R is a general programming language, especially suited for statistical analysis and cleaning and visualization of data.
We assume absolutely no previous experience with programming, and will cover the basics of getting started with R, including:
<ul>

column2: • Navigating in RStudio, and how to interact with R
• Simple arithmetic and logical operations on data
• Working with functions - and how to write a very simple function ourself
• And how to make a couple of the common graphs, that are as useful as they are elementary.

Please note that this course will be held in english if any participants requests it. Otherwise it will be held in danish.

3768377;Introduction to OpenRefine  how to clean messy data;FALSE;2021-10-04T09:00:00Z;2021-10-04T10:00:00Z;"

Sometimes data is messy and needs cleaning before you can analyze and visualize the data. For example, to merge different spellings (e.g. ‘Denmark’ and ‘DK’) or to delete blanks before a number. OpenRefine is an open source and free tool, which can help you clean messy data.
On the course you will have the opportunity to:
<ul>

column2: • Discuss the differences between the datatypes: string (text), number, date, boolean (binary, e.g. TRUE or FALSE) and arrays (lists).
• Work with several data cleaning options in OpenRefine.
• Edit the data via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface as well as via simple coding.
• Export the file to excel after the cleaning.

column1: You can work with your own data (excel-file), or you can use the excel-file provided by the instructor. If you bring your own file, you will have the opportunity to test whether OpenRefine is the right tool for your data.
This is a basic introduction, so you are not expected to have worked with OpenRefine before the course.
Preparation:
<ul>

column2: • If possible, bring your own excel-file with messy data. If you have specific questions about how to clean you data, please send the question and excel-file to kubdatalab@kb.dk at least two days before the course.

column1: After the course you should have:
<ul>

column2: • A basic understanding of OpenRefine – for which data types and tasks you can use the tool.
• Worked with simple data cleaning operations via OpenRefine’s graphical user interface and via OpenRefine’s coding options (GREL and Regular Expressions).

column1: Materials
<ul>

column2: • Exercises that we will use at the course (to be uploadet)
• Excel file that you can use if you do not have your own data with you for the course (to be uploaded)
• Introduction to OpenRefine (textbook) https://ruben.verborgh.org/publications/verborgh_packt_2013/ - Copenhagen University Library has an electronic copy

column1: Practical information

Please note: If there are non-Danish speakers, this course will take place in English. (If all attendees are Danish speakers, it will take place in Danish.)

3759644;Online: NVivo - Introduction to Qualitative Data Analysis Software (QDAS) (English);FALSE;2021-10-05T08:00:00Z;2021-10-05T11:00:00Z;"
Please note: This course will be held online via Zoom. A link will be sent to attendees.
Please also note: This course will take place in English (unless all attendees prefer it in Danish).
Introduction to NVivo. A programme, which is a great help when you are working with qualitative data analysis.
NVivo can be useful, if you want to organise and/or code your empirical material or literature. It can also be helpful when you want to transcribe audio- or video files, generate hypotheses etc.
The teaching is based on the PC version of NVivo, where the program works best. The Mac-version of the programme is not on the same level as the PC version, but you can attend the course with a Mac.
Prior to the course, you must install NVivo on your laptop. Registration key is available through the UCPH software Library.
We also ask you to complete a set of introductory exercises before course start, that you can read about HERE.
The course requires a minimum of six participants.

/Erik Schwägermann (es@kb.dk) and Daniel Pryn (pryn@kb.dk)

3760529;Åbent værksted i Labbet / drop in consultations at KUB Datalab;FALSE;2021-10-06T10:30:00Z;2021-10-06T12:30:00Z;"

Having problems importing data? Or cleaning it? Is the structure weird, or are you getting strange error messages when you try to fit a model?
Drop in with your data and your problem, and we will do our best to help you. We offer no opinions on what statistical test you should run on your data. But we will get it to work.

No registration required, we try to assist everyone, but if necessary on a "first-come, first-served" basis

3749468;Python og Digital Humaniora - Online grundkursus;FALSE;2021-10-06T10:30:00Z;2021-10-06T12:30:00Z;"

Kurset hedder 'Python og Digital Humaniora', men studerende fra alle fag er meget velkommen til at tilmelde sig.

Formålet er primært at få en god oplevelse og sekundært at lære lidt om, hvordan man kan benytte programmeringssproget Python inden for fag, hvor man arbejder typisk arbejder med tekster som datagrundlag, f.eks. humaniora, teologi, jura, samfunds- og sundhedsfag.
Vi bruger Jupyter notebook, der er en del af en pakke, der hedder Anaconda, som man inden kurset skal have downloadet og installeret herfra: https://www.anaconda.com/products/individual
Cirka 24 timer inden kursusstart vil tilmeldte deltagere via mail modtage mødelink og materiale i en zipfil til brug på workshoppen.

NB:. Kurset starter på det angivende klokkeslet og ikke efter et akademisk kvarter.

The course will be held in english if at least one participant doesn't understand danish, otherwise in danish
